data.title: Marvin Dodd
data.text:
Visitation: Monday, October 31, 2005 at Stevenson & Sons Funeral Home in Miles City.

Funeral Service: Tuesday, November 1, 2005 at 2:00 pm at the chapel of Stevenson & Sons Funeral Home in Miles City

Interment: will follow in the Custer County Cemetery in Miles City

Marvin Dodd, age 90, of Miles City passed away on Wednesday, October 26, 2005 at his home in Miles City.

Marvin was born in Colony, Wyoming on May 5, 1915, the son of Andrew Jackson and Victoria (McCumsey) Dodd. He was raised and lived in the Alzada vicinity, attending grade school there. He married Alice Johnson of Seely, Wyoming on October 12, 1940 where they owned and operated a small ranch. They later moved to Alzada where he held half interest in a bar, caf and cabins. Several years later they moved to Miles City where Marvin worked for a beer wholesaler. He bought interest in the Bison Bar which he ran jointly for ten years. He owned and operated a beer wholesale for a number of years. He later worked delivering gas and fuel for John Etchemendy. They built and restored sheep wagons after retiring.

Marvin is survived by his wife, Alice Dodd of Miles City, MT; two sons: Leland (Merna) Dodd of Miles City, MT and Robert (Arlys) Dodd of San Antonia, TX; a brother, James (Vivian) Dodd of Alzada, MT; three grandsons, one granddaughter, five great grandchildren; and numerous nieces and nephews and two sisters-in-law; Fern Davidson and Evelyn Dodd.

He was preceded in death by his parents, three brothers: Kendrick, Lloyd, and Horace; and a sister, Gertrude Wilk.

Should friends desire, memorials may be made to the charity of oneâ€™s choice.
